submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: This feature displays your organization's territory structure and allows your call center users to commit an appropriate booking window to the customer based on technician availability in the selected territory.
This submodule calculates the latitude and longitude for the given address using Google geocoder.
This submodule is a collection of utilities related to the Expression builder screen used in various configuration screens of ServiceMax
Select Mail Merge Template
Module is a collection of related functionality. This screen lists the standard modules installed with ServiceMax and also allows to define custom modules that can be built as ServiceMax extensions.

Display Tags are used in all ServiceMax screens on buttons, labels as well as messages. This screen lists standard display tags installed with ServiceMax and also allows to define custom tags that can be used in ServiceMax extensions.
Settings are configurable parameters based on which functionality in a submodule changes. This page lists the standard settings in a given submodule and also allows to define custom settings.

The display tags in ServiceMax can be translated into all languages supported by the Salesforce platform. Using this screen, you can enter translations for the tags by selecting a language from the list.

This is the launching pad to configure ServiceMax application for users. Using the options listed in this page, modules, submodules, settings, configuration profiles, translations etc. can be configured.

Configuration Profile is a collection of setting values linked to one or more users, and comprise of org-wide settings or group-wide settings. This screen allows definition of configuration profiles, define their access rights, and specify setting values. ServiceMax end  user functionality is directly impacted by these settings.

This screen is used during installation and upgrade of ServiceMax, and requires a valid installation key. This screen loads the 'factory' settings and other meta data required for ServiceMax functionality.

Submodule is a specific functionality within a module. This screen lists the standard submodules installed with ServiceMax and also to define custom submodules that can be built as ServiceMax extensions.
List of Inventory Processes
Edit/Manage Inventory Process
Record mapping is used when a new record is created using an existing record. For example, RMA from a Work Order.
Using this functionality, administrators can view existing field mapping and create new field mapping between two record types.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Popup Window To Edit Setting Values
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: This is a generic screen launched to capture range of values, default value and instance value for a configuration setting.

This submodule implements backend validations that ensures integrity of configuration data. Standard (Factory) data can be created only using a valid installation key. Custom configuration data can be created without installation key but must adhere to certain naming conventions.

This screen is used to configure the functionality of ServiceMax iPad client. Configurable features include: fields to be displayed in Work Order View screen, fields to be updated in Work Order Update screen etc.

Using this feature, ServiceMax administrators can assemble various steps such as SFM transactions, inventory processes etc. to enable a wizard-based guided execution of each step. Multiple wizards can be configured for each object
This submodule represents all reusable VisualForce Components in ServiceMax
Using this feature, ServiceMax administrators can configure any URL-based action that can be launched from a record. Actions configured here can be then used in SFM wizards
This feature allows ServiceMax administrators to migrate completed SFM transaction definitions from the current instance (production or sandbox org) to any target (production) instance.
This feature is currently applicable only for iPad deployments. Use this feature to define which user profiles have access to View and Standalone Create SFM transactions

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Setup Field Updates For Dispatch Console
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: Use this feature to configure up to 10 fields that can be edited/updated by Dispatch Console users. Fields configured here will be displayed in the Edit Event popup window
This is an interactive screen that lists work orders in a queue, and allows dispatchers to find technicians or service teams based on configurable criteria, and queue, assign or schedule work orders.
Submodule to show past, current and future entitlements for a customer or customer's products during the support process.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Derive Product from IB on Case
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: Based on a configuration setting, this feature automatically derives the product from an installed product on Case object.
This feature allows your organization to define how automatic entitlement of customers is performed on Cases.
This feature is embedded in Case and performs entitlement check automatically using the applicable rules.
Submodule to show past, current and future entitlements for a customer or customer's products during the support process.
This submodule represents the collection of global settings applicable across all functionality in ServiceMax. These settings are typically shared by many submodules.
Help for Scontrol

This submodule enables end users to perform inventory processing on various inventory-enabled transactions such as RMA, Shipment, Work Order etc. This is a generic engine that displays the appropriate user interface and performs inventory actions using the inventory process settings
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client used to generate, view and save a service report
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to Troubleshooting
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to the Calendar
This submodule represents all the general functionality in the iPad client
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to the Chatter View
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to be About info
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to Tasks
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to Alert Box
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to Home Page
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to Map
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to SFM Page
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to Login Screen
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to Product Manual
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to Map View
Create child installed product

This feature creates warranty records for installed product based on the warranty terms defined. This feature can be configured to create warranty either during installed product insert or update or both or manually.
Create Case from Installed Product
Installed Product Tree

This screen allows your organization to define applicable counters based on Product information. Counters are then used to define coverage in warranty or service contract, capture readings for installed products, and to verify entitlements.

This is a generic feature that can be launched from Case, Work Order and Installed Product screens. It shows the previous reading for all the counters applicable to a given installed product and allows users to enter the current reading for each of the counters.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Manage Coverage by Counters in Warranty
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: This feature allows users to define warranty coverage using product counters.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Manage Coverage by Counters in Service Contract
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: This feature allows users to define service contract coverage using product counters.
Create Work Order from Installed Product
This submodule is used for managing ServiceMax offline profiles. It lists standard and custom profiles, and allows administrators to create, edit, clone, activate or delete offline profiles
This submodule is used to create or edit a ServiceMax offline profile. An offline profile consists of datasets, tab orders and user permissions.
This submodule is used to create or edit a dataset. A dataset contains criteria for download, locking and archival, along with default list of columns, tab access etc.
This submodule drives functionality behind display of Calendar in Offline client.
Data synchronization is responsible for uploading and downloading of application data between Offline client and Salesforce Online. The scope of data is defined using datasets

Object tab is a generic submodule that represents the behavior of how an object's tab functions in Offline client. An Offline object tab typically consists of 3 sections: Manage Views, Object data grid and Calendar.

This is a generic submodule that allows offline users to create or edit records for an object (Account or Work Order for example). It paints the object screen using Salesforce page layout definition and saves the data in the Offline database.

This is a generic submodule that allows offline users to view an existing record of an object (Account or Work Order for example). It paints the object screen using Salesforce page layout definition in read-only mode.
This submodule refers to the screen in ServiceMax Offline Client where the end user can customize the look and feel of the offline application
This submodule corresponds to the functionality of the ServiceMax Offline Client login screen
This submodule drives functionality behind display of Tasks in Offline client.
This submodule drives functionality behind Attachment in Offline client.
This screen is meant for ServiceMax administrators to manage the organization wide settings for OptiMax engine including the authorization credentials.
This submodule represents the collection of background processes that perform dispatch optimization

This submodule represents all the automatic calculations that are performed on a work order from a dispatch management standpoint. This includes simple assignment as well as pre-calculations for OptiMax.
This functionality shows a custom page to capture source and target locations, allow multiple lines to be edited and creates an RMA. While creating RMA, it also applies configurable field mappings.

This functionality shows a custom page to capture source and target locations, allow multiple lines to be edited and creates a shipment order. While creating shipment order, it also applies configurable field mappings.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Calculate Price for RMA Lines VF
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: Using a configurable price book name, this feature automatically calculates the price for an RMA line.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Calculate Price for Shipment Lines VF
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: Using a configurable price book name, this feature automatically calculates the price for a Shipment line.
This functionality displays a list of pending items to be shipped on a shipment order, allows user to enter ship quantity and/or short-close remaining lines.

This functionality displays a list of pending items to be shipped on a shipment order, allows user to enter ship quantity and/or short-close remaining lines. Based on the stock attributes of the products and locations, inventory updates are made and/or serial number information is captured.

This functionality displays a list of pending lines in an RMA, allows user to enter quantity received and/or short-close remaining requests. Based on the stock attributes of the products and locations, inventory updates are made and/or serial number information is captured.
This functionality allows the user to cancel an open shipment order.
This functionality allows users to close all the open lines in an RMA or Shipment order in one click.
This is related to sample Parts Order reports provided in the package ServiceMax Utility Pack.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Calculate Price for Parts Request Lines
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: Using a configurable price book name, this feature automatically calculates the price for a parts request line.
This functionality allows multiple lines to be added, updated or deleted in a standalone parts request.
This functionality shows the list of pending lines in a standalone parts request, allows user to enter ship quantity and creates a shipment order for the selected lines.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Receive Parts from Warehouse for a Parts Request
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: This functionality displays a list of pending lines in a standalone part request from a Warehouse, allows user to enter quantity received and/or short-close remaining requests. Based on the stock attributes of the products and locations, inventory updates are made and serial number information is captured.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Receive Parts from Supplier for a Parts Request
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: This functionality displays a list of pending lines in a standalone part request from a Supplier, allows user to enter quantity received and/or short-close remaining requests. Based on the stock attributes of the products and locations, inventory updates are made and serial number information is captured.
This functionality allows the user to cancel a standalone open parts request.
This functionality shows the list of pending lines in a standalone parts request, allows user to enter ship quantity and creates a shipment order for the selected lines.
This is related to sample Parts Request report provided in the package ServiceMax Utility Pack.
This submodule lists all existing basic preventive maintenance plans in a service contract and allows users to create new plans or edit existing plans.
This submodule allows contract administrators to create a new basic preventive maintenance plan or edit an existing plan using a wizard-like interface.
This submodule runs in the background at regular intervals, identifies appropriate basic PM plans and automatically creates cases and work orders as configured in the plans.

This submodule is for all automatic background actions to be performed when basic preventive maintenance work orders are saved. Actions include creating tasks for technicians and updating PM statistics.
This functionality performs inventory updates for a stock adjustment transaction. Depending upon stock attributes of the location and product, serial number information is also captured.
This functionality allows users to activate a current (valid) contract to be activated.
This functionality allows users to renew an existing service contract by copying coverage information.
This functionality allows users to cancel an active existing service contract and prohibiting its use in entitlement check.
This is related to sample Service Contract report provided in the package ServiceMax Utility Pack.
SFM Transaction Designer provides an interactive wizard-like interface to define SFM transactions, rules and end-user interface. The configured SFM transactions can then be deployed using SFM wizard.
SFM Transaction Delivery Engine delivers the configured SFM transactions to end users using a rich and advanced user interface

This feature provides the ability to create, modify or delete SLA Terms. For each SLA Terms, users can define the scope of commitment for response, restoration and resolution times, as well as the scope of services included
This feature displays a countdown of remaining time for various levels of SLA commitment, where applicable. It also allows users to pause and restart the clock.
This feature displays a countdown of remaining time for various levels of SLA commitment, where applicable. It also allows users to pause and restart the clock.

This functionality shows available stock for a given parts request line on work order or a standalone parts request line, in locations within a given radius of the target location. The information is plotted on a Google map. The user can then request the part from one of the locations displayed on the map.

This submodule provides a streamlined way to manage your service organization. Using this link, you can create or edit service teams and manage technicians, along with their expertise, product specializations and cost.
This submodule provides an interactive tree-based hierarchical way to manage your service territories along with the scope of coverage for each territory as well as soft (adjacent) territories.
This functionality performs inventory updates for a stock transfer transaction. Depending upon stock attributes of the location and product, serial number information is also captured.
This functionality allows multiple lines to be added, updated or deleted in a stock transfer.

This functionality shows a page where closure information such as Work Performed, Symptom etc. are captured, and then the work order status to Closed, and sets the closed by and timestamp automatically.
This feature displays all estimate lines in a work order, allows the user to choose, and creates a service quote for the selected items.

This functionality shows all estimate lines in a work order, allows user to select one or more items, and creates them as usage lines. While creating usage lines, it also applies configurable field mapping.
This functionality shows a custom page to capture work order record type and creates a work order automatically. While creating the work order, it also applies configurable field mappings.
This allows multiple lines to be added, updated or deleted on a work order. The lines can be estimates, requests or usage/consumption.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Calculate Price for Work Order Estimates
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: Using a configurable price book name, this feature automatically calculates the price for a work order estimate line.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Calculate Price for Work Order Usage
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: Using a configurable price book name, this feature automatically calculates the price for a work order usage line.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Post to Inventory - Work Order Usage
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: This functionality performs inventory updates for usage lines in a work order. Depending upon stock attributes of the location and product, serial number information is also captured.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Receive Parts for a Work Order
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: This functionality displays a list of pending part requests in a work order, allows user to enter quantity received and/or short-close remaining requests. Based on the stock attributes of the products and locations, inventory updates are made and/or serial number information is captured.
This screen allows your organization to define rules based on work order information to calculate MTTS (Mean Time To Service). MTTS is used by OptiMax for advanced dispatch optimization.
This feature enables your organization to define how primary territory for work orders are calculated. This is useful when service territories across your organization have varying types of coverage.
This feature lists all the dispatch processes defined in ServiceMax and allows you to create new, edit or delete existing processes.
This screen captures detailed information about dispatch processes for both simple and advanced methods of dispatch.
This screen allows your organization to define rules based on work order fields. This rule is used by dispatch console to determine the default Subject for new events.
This screen allows your organization to define rules based on work order fields. This rule is used by dispatch console to display relevant information on event hovers in the calendar section.
This functionality allows automatic update of all the Work Order parts request lines, with Received Qty and Date Received set to Requested Qty value and current date respectively.
This functionality allows the user to cancel all open parts request lines or a specific parts request line in a work order.
This is related to sample Work Order reports provided in the package ServiceMax Utility Pack.

You can use this area to define your service delivery network. Routes & Stops for returned products can be defined as inbound routes terminating in repair/disposition centers. Similarly, you can setup Routes & Stops for outbound parts & repaired products which are shipped to customers.

This screen provides an easy and intuitive way to manage Service Parts Depots (Warehouses) and Stocking Locations within them. You can define multi-level hierarchical structure to represent regional depots, field stocking locations, central warehouses, etc. Within a depot, stocking locations such as receiving, holding, delivery, and staging can be defined.
Use this option to define how various depots (hubs, warehouses or repair centers) would process outbound products from picking to shipping.

In this area, you can configure returns process (RMA) for returns originating from customers. A typical customer returns process involves performing entitlement checks & route calculation. One or more RMA's will be created based on destination depots as a result of this process.
Creating RMA
Process Shipment
Process Receipt
Forward Shipment Console
Fulfillment Console

Use this option to configure when Outbound routes must be calculated from work orders and external (reverse) RMAs from suppliers. Use relevant attributes in work orders and RMAs that indicate the repair cycle is complete and product is ready to make its return journey to customer.

This screen provides an easy and intuitive way to manage Service Parts Depots (Warehouses) and Stocking Locations within them. You can define multi-level hierarchical structure to represent regional depots, field stocking locations, central warehouses, etc. Within a depot, stocking locations such as receiving, holding, delivery, and staging can be defined.
This area can be used to configure sourcing strategies for products & depots. Product attributes can be used to drive fulfillment of parts from different regional depots & forward stocking locations.

This area can be used to setup one or more products as alternatives for a given product and establish order of preference. Substitutions defined here are used in Fulfillment Console to drive exchange product fulfillment.

Forwarding engine automatically creates shipment orders to the next stop in the route based on route cards. In this area, you can define which RMA s will be processed by the engine. The configuration should be setup for each Depot exclusively. You can also specify a schedule for the depot.

Use this option to view standard SFM search configurations or to create custom SFM search configurations. SFM Search configurations include the objects in scope, the fields to be searched upon, pre-filter conditions and how the results are displayed.
Usage objects and configurations

Use this screen to configure how your end users will use ServiceMax Mobile Client on iPad. You can configure data download criteria, frequency of synchronization, limits that may apply to the size of offline data and more.

SFM Search Engine enables configuration of searches and delivery of the configured searches. The search configuration includes the objects in scope, the fields to be searched upon, pre-filter conditions, and how the results are displayed.
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to Synchronization

Use this option to view standard Work Order Views or to create custom Work Order Views. View definition includes the Work Order fields to be filtered upon, pre-filter conditions, and how the results are displayed.
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to SFM Search
This submodule refers to all the generic functionality in Offline client.
This submodule represents all functionality in the iPad client related to tracking the location of technician.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Setup Work Order Auto Ent Rules
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: This feature allows your organization to define how automatic entitlement of customers is performed on Work Orders.

Use this option to configure proforma invoice processes for Service Contracts. You can indicate how service contracts are consolidated into an invoice, the type of lines to include and more. You can also setup the process to run automatically on a schedule.

Use this option to configure proforma invoice processes for Work Orders. You can indicate how service contracts are consolidated into an invoice, the type of Work Order lines to include and more. You can also setup the process to run automatically on a schedule.
This screen allows your organization to define rules based on work order fields. This rule is used by dispatch console to display relevant information on icon hovers in the map section.
This submodule represents both automatic and interactive creation of proforma invoice for Work Orders.
This submodule represents both automatic and interactive creation of proforma invoice for Service Contracts.
This feature is embedded in Work Order and performs entitlement check automatically using the applicable rules.
This submodule is used to configure SFM transactions to be used wherever the transactions are not launched from a wizard. Typically this configuration is used in New button overrides.
SFW Delivery Engine delivers the configured Service Flow Wizards to end users using the Service Flow Wizard definitions.
Use this option to configure PM Process.
Server cache contains the metadata of one or more sObjects used across all SFM processes.
SFM Output Document Delivery Engine delivers the configured SFM Output Documents to end users using a rich and advanced user interface.
This feature enables your organization to define criteria for finding eligible technicians for work orders.
This feature enables your organization to define mandatory and optional skills required to complete work orders.
This allows multiple activities to be added, updated or deleted on a case.
This sub module represents all functionality in the iPad Client related to attachments.
This is a generic submodule to define ServiceMax Event related behavior and configuration.
This refers to appointment booking for continuous optimization
This refers to delivery of continuous optimization to mobile client applications.

Scheduled SFM Engine processes SFM Transactions configured for automatic, background execution on qualifying records at scheduled times. Each Scheduled SFM Process can have one or more SFM Transactions and one or more schedules for them.
This refers to continuous optimization through integration with ServicePower.
Manage Data Lookup Rules
This submodule automate ServiceMax app provisions at User level.
This encompasses all the configurable functionality related to management of events.

submodules.SVMXC_NAME_C: Manage Installed Base App Settings (NOT IN USE)
submodules.SVMXC_DESCRIPTION_C: Settings for Installed Base App
This submodule represents all the general functionality in Installed Base App client.
This submodule allows contract administrators to define Service Performance Metrics Configurations.
This submodule represents all functionality related to Pulse Application.
This encompasses all the configurable functionality related to scheduling exception management.

Timesheet Engine runs at scheduled intervals, to create timesheets and time entries from work details, events, and tasks, as per timesheet configuration. The schedule of execution and other details related to processing of timesheets are defined in timesheet configuration.

Timesheet configuration encompasses defining how to identify the relevant technician activities, how to process them using filters and mappings, and at what scheduled intervals the processing must be done.
This submodule allows ServiceMax administrators to configure settings that are essential for real-time optimization.
This submodule enables end users to perform Parts-related transactions such as Parts Lookup, Stock Transfer etc. on FSA.
Enable usage statistics.
This has all the settings related to Service Board.
This submodule represents the configs used in the Action Service.
This submodule represents the configs used in the Publish Service.
Configure mobile timesheet features.
FCO Console configuration determines how certain functionality in the Field Change Order Wizard will behave, such as FCO Search and Work Order Generation.
Includes settings that control mobile sync activities and interactions between Go mobile apps and the sync gateway.
Includes settings to configure different features for ServiceMax Go.
